newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: MTV Asia signs Philippines deal with ABS-CBN.
newsitem.headline: MTV Asia signs Philippines deal with ABS-CBN.

text.p: Music Television (MTV) Networks Asia said on Tuesday it signed a deal with Philippines broadcaster ABS-CBN to supply programmes to ABS-CBN's newly-launched UHF station, Studio 23.

A statement issued by MTV, a unit of Viacom, said Studio 23, launched on October 12, would take its first MTV feed later this month, reaching more than 1.6 million homes in Manila, Cebu and Davao. It gave no financial details.
MTV currently operates two 24-hour networks in Asia: MTV Mandarin and MTV Asia. It plans to launch a third service, MTV India, at the end of October, the statement said.
